title:
A Fixed Point Iteration Technique for Proving Correctness of Slicing for
  Probabilistic Programs
abstract:
When proving the correctness of a method for slicing probabilistic programs,
it was previously discovered by the authors that for a fixed point iteration to
work one needs a non-standard starting point for the iteration.
  This paper presents and explores this technique in a general setting; it
states the lemmas that must be established to use the technique to prove the
correctness of a program transformation, and sketches how to apply the
technique to slicing of probabilistic programs.
